definition: A small emblem worn to show membership, rank or achievement.
examples: The scout sewed a new badge on her sleeve.
Staff must wear an identity badge.

extra.memory_tip: Badge = little symbol you pin on.

definition: A long strip of cloth or paper with words or pictures for decoration or advertisement.
examples: A welcome banner hung above the door.
Protesters carried colourful banners.

extra.memory_tip: Banner = big sign you hang up.

definition: The point or area where two lines or surfaces meet; to trap something so it cannot escape.
examples: The shop is on the corner of High Street.
Police cornered the suspect in an alley.

extra.memory_tip: Corner = place where sides meet or action of boxing in.

definition: A plan or drawing for how something will look; to create such a plan.
examples: The dress has a floral design. (noun)
Architects design new buildings. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Design = idea on paper or act of making that idea.

definition: Something shown to the public; to show something clearly.
examples: The museum has a dinosaur display. (noun)
Shop windows display the newest toys. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Display = put out so all can see.

definition: A line or mark where something is bent; to bend something over itself.
examples: There is a fold in the map. (noun)
Please fold the letter neatly. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fold = bend paper or cloth over.

definition: A public procession celebrating a day or event; to march or display proudly.
examples: The town holds a parade on Remembrance Day. (noun)
Soldiers paraded through the square. (verb)

definition: A four-sided shape with four right angles and opposite sides equal.
examples: A sheet of paper is a rectangle.
Draw a large rectangle on the board.

extra.memory_tip: Rectangle = four straight sides, like a door.

definition: A formal gesture of respect, especially by a member of the armed forces; to make such a gesture.
examples: The officer gave a crisp salute. (noun)
They saluted the flag. (verb)

definition: The pattern on a tyre or shoe that touches the ground; to step or walk.
examples: The tyre tread was worn out. (noun)
Mind where you tread in the mud. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Tread = your step or the grip underfoot.
